page.title: 20Language
page.content: Around fifty years ago most people were welsh speaking however this has greatly changed. Many English families have moved into the area and it has become far more Angliced.Today 50% of the people in our block are welsh speaking and eventhough all the children are taught Welsh as a second langauge the playground the language today is English. The Welsh are very proud of thier language and try to keep it alive in the local Chapels;there is an annual Eisteddfod held in the local hall.Many people especially the elderly still prefere to speak welsh and many shops and officers in the local towns insist that there employees are welsh speaking.On St David's Day the children of the area dress in traditional Welsh costume wear leeks and daffodils and sing and recite.
